blocks.content: A temperature and humidity sensor project using an Arduino allows you to monitor environmental conditions such as ambient temperature and relative humidity. This project typically utilizes a sensor like the DHT11 or DHT22, which are popular for their ease of use and affordability. Such a project is ideal for creating weather stations, monitoring greenhouses, or even automating indoor climate control.
- Temperature & Humidity Sensor (e.g., DHT11 or DHT22)
- Connect the VCC pin of the sensor to the 5V pin on the Arduino.
- Connect the GND pin of the sensor to the GND pin on the Arduino.
- Connect the data pin of the sensor to a digital input pin (for example, pin 2) on the Arduino.
